result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerome T Jenkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine is to be paid in full by 10-30-2015 or serve 5 days jail with Huber as penalty for failure to pay fine.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Katrina Seipel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Anna M Kees in court.   
Defendant Jerome T Jenkins did not appear.  
Attorney appeared by authorization.

State moves to amend count 1 to a County Ordinance of D.C. 13.102(c)(8).
Defense has no objections.

Atty. Kees enters a plea of No Contest to the amended charge on behalf of her client.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the amended charge.
Count 2 is dismissed and read in.

Court orders the following:
Fine:  $267.50
To be paid in full by:  10/30/15
Alternate:  5 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
Authorization to Appear, received and filed in court.

Lucas Paul Bennewitz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Anna M Kees in court.  
Defendant Jerome T Jenkins did not appear.   
Attorney appeared by Authorization.
State's offer is predicated on treatment.
Defendant is currently engaged in treatment.
  Hearing scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Defendant's Supplemental Demand filed by Attorney Kees.

Defendant is not to have any violent contact with any neighbors.   Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.
Defendant Jerome T Jenkins in court with attorney Jonathan LaVoy.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
